abstract: Mark Zuckerberg’s $100 million grant to Newark’s schools, announced on “The Oprah Winfrey Show,” propelled him to the top of American philanthropy and made him something of a hero.
snippet: Mark Zuckerberg’s $100 million grant to Newark’s schools, announced on “The Oprah Winfrey Show,” propelled him to the top of American philanthropy and made him something of a hero.
lead_paragraph: PALO ALTO  Mark Zuckerberg, America’s youngest billionaire at 26, has not spent much money on himself. Forbes estimates his fortune at $6.9 billion, but Mr. Zuckerberg, chief executive of Facebook, has yet to sell any sizable portion of his holdings in the company.

headline.main: From Young Mogul, a Gift on the Scale of Philanthropy’s Elders
headline.print_headline: From Young Mogul, a Gift on the Scale of Philanthropy’s Elders
